reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed In Radisson Glasgow weekend friday 2nd may 08.Receptionist Charmaine couldnt have been nicer. When we got to our room a twin,one of the beds was so uncomfortable there was no way I could sleep on it . When I brought this to the managers attention he gave me a different much nicer room and didn't charge us for our first nights stay. Now thats the way to look after the customer. Happy with new room we headed to the bar where we were greeted by the most friendly barperson ever think her name was Unn I know she was swedish an absolute credit to the hotel. The radisson glasgow has the most courteous and friendly staff of any radisson I have stayed in. The breakfast was superb omelletes cooked in front of you and eggs benidict to die for. All in all a fab hotel for a overnight or weekend away.

Our rate didn't include breakfast and £15 per head was very steep for what was there. A lot of the containers were empty or the contents dried up. We were seated at a table with no butter, tea spoons, sugar or salt and pepper. We were also seated right by the entrance which meant no waiters came near us, we had to keep going and asking for things. I am used to hotel breakfast prices working in the travel industry, but my friends aren't and were very disappointed with what they ate for what they paid.

reviews.text: This hotel was almost perfect in every way. The design of the hotel is fabulous and the room was spacious enough that we didn't feel cramped (even though we had a roll away bed put in the room for our daughter). The staff was helpful and gracious and the amenities were abundant. The health club facilities are an actual LA Fitness (rather than the normal room with a few old machines). If you are travelling by train, the hotel sits right next to the Central Station in Glasgow. It is also in close proximity to the shopping district and local attractions. We loved this hotel and would definitely choose it again the next time in Glasgow.

reviews.text: Locating the hotel using Mapquest from the airport we discovered 2 Argyle streets in Glasgow as we searched in vain for the hotel on the wrong Argyle street.Safer to get directions using route planners to Central station which is across the road from the hotel. This is a modern hotel in design but has fabulously comfortable rooms that are bright and airy with excellent airconditioning which was very necessary on the weekend we were there. Although located at a busy intersection with floor to ceiling windows in the rooms, they were nonetheless quiet. Car parking is available across the street in the NCP 24 hour car park. Hotel reception will code your ticket so you can get parking for just £5 a day a big saving on the listed prices. The reception staff were excellent, naturally friendly and willing to help - thank you Lesley. A casual enquiry at reception about church times resulted in an answer that was unsure. We left it at that and couldn,t believe a phone call the next morning giving precise details and location.That was customer service at it's best. The buffet breakfast would set anyone up for the rest of the day with no need to eat until evening in our case.Overall the hotel and particularly the reception staff were excellent.

I stayed in the hotel for the final three nights of my vacation that had begun in the Scottish Highlands for a walking tour. I booked with the Radisson on-line opting for the internet rate that included all taxes, service and breakfast. Although these special rates can be good on the pocket, you never know about the room you might get, or what constitutes breakfast. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel, and the room. I wanted a small bit of luxury following my walking tour and I got it. The room was well-fitted and very comfortable and generally quiet (and you've got to love the heated bathroom floors). The breakfast buffet was excellent and I remarked on this each morning. The location is superb. I had arrived from the Highlands into Glasgow via the Queen Street Station and there is a bus (one pound twenty vs. a much more expensive, though very short, taxi ride) to Central Station, which is across from the hotel. Walking and exploring the area is easy and safe (although I wouldn't know about late in the evening). Finally, the quality of room service, for dinner, is also excellent and it is refreshing to find that there are no added fees to the menu prices and you're simply required to tip the person who delivers it. With all the glory I'm bestowing on this hotel, I will also note two detractors: If there is a wedding or celebration being held in the ballroom, beware, since I could hear the music thumping in room 522 and evidently some of the party's guests were in rooms near mine. These were small interruptions and only one night - it was otherwise very quiet. The second is that huge bus tours book this hotel (e.g. Trafalgar, Globus) and probably because the hotel is big and similar to U.S. quality. I'm extremely proud of being American, but I don't go abroad to vacation in the midst of throngs of my countrymen. I was aware this might happen in a Radisson and was mildly amused while people watching from the lobby bar. So, with all this said, I cannot compare the hotel to other Glasgow hotels, but don't think I'd need to book elsewhere if I returned again for a visit. Cheers!

reviews.text: We flew to Scotland from the US in July 2005. The Glasgow SAS was our first hotel and we could not have made a better choice. This is definately the hotel-of-choice for Glasgow. The room was very quiet and extremely clean. The bed was incredibly comfortable (we woke up at 11 am- I haven't slept that many hours in years!!!) The hotel staff was exceptional. I wish I had written down the name of the bellman so I could specifically thank him. He was unbelievably helpful and kind. Everyone we came in contact with bent-over-backwards to make sure our stay perfect. We walked all over Glasgow that night to find a restaurant and ended up back at the hotel. "Thank Goodness" because our meal was fantastic! The dishes were extremely tasty. The menu was a perfect mix of tried-and- true favorites combined with some new tastes we had yet explore. The presentation of every course was fabulous. It was a quiet, relaxing and smoke-free environment that was just exactly what we needed. In the future we will definately stay our first 1-2 nights at the Glasgow SAS to rest and get over the jet-lag before we venture into the rest of the country. It was the perfect way for 2 very road-weary travelers to start their vacation. Prior to embarking on our trip we had rcd many warnings about the quality of the hotels in this part of the country. Our experience at this hotel could not have been more perfect. My husband and I are both Platinum status with Marriott and Diamond status with Hilton. In other words, we sleep in hotels more often than we do our own bed! This hotel surpassed all of our expectations. To all of the staff, Thank you very, very much. You are a gem!!! Kelly & Mike
reviews.title: Perfect Utopia for Road-Weary Travelers
